comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Jan Christiaan Smuts OM CH ED KC FRS PC (24 May 1870 – 11 September 1950) was a prominent South African and British Commonwealth statesman, military leader and philosopher. In addition to holding various cabinet posts, he served as Prime Minister of the Union of South Africa from 1919 until 1924 and from 1939 until 1948. He served in the First World War and as a British field marshal in the Second World War.

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Smuts was the only person to sign the treaties ending both WWI and WWII, and was a strong proponent of the League of Nations.

comment.author: 35072786@N08
comment._content: swanq and Richard Arthur Norton:  Thank you for identifying Jan Christiaan Smuts. We will add his fuller name and additional information to the description when we update.
